sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine operates between two heat reservoirs at temperatures 400 K and 300 K. Determine the maximum possible efficiency of the engine.
message_2:
The maximum possible efficiency of a heat engine operating between two heat reservoirs is given by the Carnot efficiency, which is determined by the temperatures of the reservoirs. The Carnot efficiency is given by the formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. In this case, T_cold = 300 K and T_hot = 400 K.

Efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 400 K)
Efficiency = 1 - 0.75
Efficiency = 0.25

The maximum possible efficiency of the heat engine is 25%.
